metadata.name: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level - PowerShell
metadata.comment: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "Set-ExecutionPolicy" cmdlet.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('set-executionpolicy')) AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('unrestricted')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('bypass'))) AND NOT (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('(new-object system.net.webclient).downloadstring(\'https://community.chocolatey.org/install.ps1\')')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('(new-object system.net.webclient).downloadstring(\'https://chocolatey.org/install.ps1\')'))))

output.summary: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "Set-ExecutionPolicy" cmdlet.

metadata.objective: False positive: Administrator script References: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.security/set-executionpolicy?view=powershell-7.4, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.core/about/about_execution_policies?view=powershell-7.4, https://adsecurity.org/?p=2604
